channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drain and run off blockage, 27th November
item.description:
The drains and run off outlet on this corner are blocked, resulting in flooding during heavy rain
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two potholes close together, just after railway bridge, northbound, 27th November
item.description:
Hello, there are two potholes close together, just after the railway bridge on Pirton Lane, northbound, towards Cheltenham Road East. They are, or are close to, a recently repaired patch. This might have already been identified, but could they be reviewed and repaired ASAP please ? Thankyou !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadworks on Innsworth Lane, 27th November
item.description:
Please complete the work on Innsworth Lane opposite Rookery Road. There is never any work going on and the works should have been completed weeks ago. The road is horrendous peak time, queues from hare and hounds junction most mornings. The bus stops do not help either. Rookery Road lights are on green for over a minute but no traffic comes out of there. Please sort. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temp lights on Innsworth Lane, 27th November
item.description:
I have raised this issue a few times before but the 3 way lights in Innsworth Lane opposite Rookery Road are still there. One network said the works would be finished by 10th Nov. The traffic they cause is bedlam during school times and in the mornings you are queuing from hare and hounds pub. Please get these roadworks finished. There are so many unhappy motorists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Running water, 27th November
item.description:
Outside the Stables, water running down the road constantly, when freezing will be lethal which it is tomorrow 28/11/24 ,worried may hit ice and slide into building.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Down Hatherley Lane, Down Hatherley, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Area is subsiding, 27th November
item.description:
This area has suffered subsidence previously and the issue has returned. The road surface is being throw cars off the main driving route through the bend.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole AGAIN, 27th November
item.description:
Pothole has appeared again after it was fixed quite recently. Right in the line of the nearside tyres. Why oh why don't the contractors repair them properly? This was done less than a year ago - opening up again like an open wound. Shocking shameful complacent work by all involved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bouncers Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged road surface, 27th November
item.description:
Reported as fixed and ok, but the road surface is shockingly bad and has not been fixed. On the busy Prestbury High St - tyre damaging surfaces. Needs fixing asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, High Street, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road needs sweeping, 27th November
item.description:
The road outside Churchill Gardens on Churchill Drive needs clearing of all leaves that have fallen from big Horse Chestnut tree. The road wasnâ€™t swept last year after the leaves had fallen so there is an accumulation of dead wet leaves making for a very dirty road and possibility of blocking drains.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Churchill Drive, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover has a crack in it, 27th November
